TopicTitle: [Possible bug] Able to access vBCms Comments forum, and post new threads.

Articles.Content:
I have a possible bug to report:

Today, I hit the "New Posts" link on the top of the page ([http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search.php?searchid=5102899](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search.php?searchid=5102899)) and I saw the article about 1.0.1 being out.

I clicked on the link below "Forum" and went to the [vBCms Comments forum](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/43-vBCms-Comments), and I was surprised to see that I had new thread posting permissions, and since I thought that only official posts could be articles, I thought I should report this.

-MRS
It's not a bug; there's a separate thread for the article that you see in the news column and the thread in the Announcements subforum.

> 
> It's not a bug; there's a separate thread for the article that you see in the news column and the thread in the Announcements subforum.

The bug was that I could post new threads in it, I've never seen a article posted by a non-moderator.
Anyone willing to see what happens when you make a new thread, or if it even errors out?

> 
> Anyone willing to see what happens when you make a new thread, or if it even errors out?

I think I'll wait for a while to see if the mods address it.

>

But I doesn't show on the main page, or in articles: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/)

It does show up here: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/43-vBCms-Comments](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/43-vBCms-Comments)

Yeah, so harmless, maybe.
